qas.question: When was the UN General Assembly of the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights enacted?

answers.text: legally limited the minimum age for when children could start work at the age of 14

qas.question: When were safe working environments legislation adopted for child labourers?
What did it help do to?

answers.text: helped to reduce the exploitation of children

context: The first legal steps taken to end the occurrence of child labour was enacted more than fifty years ago. In <a0_0>1966<a0_0/>, the nation adopted the UN General Assembly of the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights. This act <a1_0>legally limited the minimum age for when children could start work at the age of 14<a1_0/>. But 23 years later in <a2_0>1989<a2_0/> the Convention on the Rights of Children was adopted and <a3_0>helped to reduce the exploitation of children<a3_0/> and demanded safe working environments. They all worked towards the goal of ending the most problematic forms of child labour.
